title: ADULTS REACT TO GIRLS LIKE YOU - MAROON 5 (Ft. Cardi B)

json.text:
- How much fun would it
have been to film this?
Like, all those stars.
- (FBE) If you could honor

one inspiration woman out there,
who would you choose?
♪ (industrial intro) ♪
♪ (guitar strumming) ♪
- Ohhh. Maroon 5.
- Maroon 5!

- I dig Maroon 5.
I always have.

- I was watching this recently.
This is sick.
- His voice is so nice.

I wish I had that falsetto.
It's insane.

- ♪ Now it's all good, babe ♪
♪ Roll that Backwood, babe ♪
♪ And play me close ♪
- This is the one with Cardi B.

- ♪ 'Cause girls like you ♪
♪ Run around with guys like me ♪

- ♪ Till sundown when I come through ♪
- Freaking love Camila.

- ♪ Girls like you love fun ♪
♪ And yeah, me too ♪
♪ What I want when I come through ♪

♪ I need a girl... ♪
- Oh!
- Oh, so they're changing.

- This is a very simple setup
compared to most of their videos.

- They only have one shot,
and they just spin,

and they used all their money
to get other people to come in.

- ♪ Yeah, yeah, yeah ♪
♪ I need a girl like you ♪

♪ I spent last night ♪
- Who's this? Who's this?
(gasps) Oh, Aly Raisman! Yes!

- Yeah, speak your truth.
You go, girl.

- ♪ I took a whole day up ♪
♪ Trying to get way up, ooh, ooh ♪
- I love Sarah Silverman.

- Can't wait for
"Wreck-It Ralph 2," by the way.

- All the girls are coming out.
It's so cute.

- Is this like a #metoo
sort of thing

where you just invite a lot
of really powerful women

like Wonder Woman
onto the music video?
- Oh my god, Gal Gadot.

- ♪ ...guys like me ♪
♪ Till sundown when I... ♪

- Must've been the easiest day
for all these girls at the studio.

Go and just dance
a little bit behind him.

- ♪ ...you love fun ♪
♪ And yeah, me too ♪
- Is that Lilly Singh?
- Oh, Lilly!
- They got YouTubers up in here!

- This is the best way to make
an otherwise patronizing song
not so patronizing.
- TIFFANY! I love Tiffany!

- This is just a rotating door
of celebrities.

- (gasps) Ohhh, Eleven.
This is so good.

- It is so beautiful
that he had Ellen on this.

Oh my god.
I love this.

- ♪ I need a... ♪
- (sings along) ♪ Girl like you ♪

- ♪ Girls like you ♪
♪ Run around with guys like me ♪
- Ah! Me... and him? Ah.

- ♪ Not too long ago,
I was dancing for dollars ♪
- (laughs) I almost destroyed the set.

- Oh, hey! I didn't know
she was gonna be in this.
- Cardi B, she's dope.

- Cardi B! The song just
went up five notches.

- ♪ So who you gonna call?
Cardi, Cardi ♪

♪ Come and rev it up
like a Harley, Harley ♪
- I'm just not a fan of her.

- Jacket reminds me of something
that April would wear
in Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.

- ♪ I don't play when it comes
to my heart, let's get it, though ♪

♪ I don't really want a white horse
and a carriage ♪

♪ I'm thinkin' more
of white Porsches and karats ♪
- Love this. Come on.

- ♪ 'Cause girls like you ♪
♪ Run around with guys like me ♪

- Is that J.Lo?
Oh my god.

- ♪ ...like you, yeah, yeah ♪
- I love so much diversity
in this music video.

- They're so fast,
I can't name 'em all.

- Man, they got, like, everyone.
What in the world?

- (sings along) ♪ Yeah, yeah, yeah ♪
Just all female empowerment.
It's really cool.

- ♪ I need a girl like you,
yeah, yeah ♪

♪ Yeah, yeah, yeah ♪
♪ Yeah, yeah, yeah ♪
♪ I need a girl like you ♪

- This must've been
a really fun shoot.

- How much fun would it
have been to film this?
Like, all those stars.
- ♪ ...girls like you ♪
- Oh, is this his wife?
(gasps) Oh, that's so cute!

- And his little daughter.
I bet it's for his little daughter.

- Look at all these women
of all colors, all shapes,
different stories, YESS!

- That was a really beautiful song.
You don't have to be a certain look

to be loved by somebody
like Adam Levine.

- A whole cast of every empowering,
amazing woman from the arts,

from social, political, sports,
from every corner of the world.

- I saw Maroon 5 the very first night
of their ever headlining tour.
And they've gone way more poppy
and dance-y and mainstream,

but that is so stripped down
and just that acoustic riff

over and over again
is kind of mesmerizing.

It's totally different,
but maybe that was
to get the message across.

- (FBE) So, that was the video
for "Girls Like You,"

the latest song from Maroon 5
featuring Cardi B.

- Mm-hmm.
I think Cardi B always adds
a fun little flair to a song.

- (FBE) We're gonna talk
about the video more in a second.

But first, what did you think
of having two artists

like Maroon 5 and Cardi b
together like this?

- I loved it.
I've been waiting for Maroon 5
to come back with some heat.

So if they're gonna come back
with some heat, they better do it

with the hottest person right now,
which is Cardi.

- It's crazy how much Cardi B
can be with anybody.

It's, like, my mom knows
who Cardi B is,

so it's kind of like,
okay, she can basically do anything.

- I really liked it, actually.
That one just really meshed well.

That one just went...
like, the beat with her

and also the lyrics just really
combined really well together.

- Cardi B definitely meshes better
with Bruno Mars and Migos.

When this video was shot,
it's like they probably

could've been in two completely
different recording studios.

So, I couldn't actually
see their chemistry.

- (FBE) So, the video was notable
for having a number

of celebrity cameos.
But in addition to just being famous,

many people pointed out
that there's a lot

of other inspirational women
included in the video.

- Yeah, definitely.
- (FBE) Among those featured

included many activists,
prominent LGBT figures,

artists, and athletes
who broke new ground

in their industry, and even the first
Somali-American Muslim legislator

to be elected to office in the US.
- Oh my gosh!

- Damn, I just got
chills a little bit.

- (FBE) So, what did you think
about their effort to include

such a diverse group of women
in this video?

- I loved it.
Different colors,

different backgrounds,
different religions.

A lot of the metoo was included
in there as well.

- It was a very diverse group
of people.

It kind of shows that we all
are strong in our own different ways.

- They could've played it safe
and just made it sort of

a generic, like, "Oh,
it's summer time!"

I say kudos to Maroon 5
for switching it up
with some political commentary.

- Maroon 5's so big
and Cardi B's so big

that people would be drawn
to this video.

They're gonna be like,
"I wanna see who I missed,"

and go like, "Okay, who was that?
Who was that? Who was that?"

and look 'em up.
It makes you dive in.

- There's so much injustice
and just hate and the news

and just the media in general.
So, it's really awesome to see

such a poppy group shine light
and use their platform

to highlight these really
inspirational women.

- (FBE) Among these women
were two who are notable

for their success on YouTube:
Franchesca Ramsey and Lilly Singh.

What do you think about how YouTube
has gone to a place

where its stars can be featured
right next to

traditional media celebrities
in a video like this?

- I love it.
I love YouTube.

Because I feel like that leaves space
for everybody to say,

"You know what?
I could make a difference too."

- They are just as much
on the same level

as Ellen DeGeneres,
as Gal Gadot, as all these people

that are so big,
these huge celebrities,

these huge athletes,
that they are just as much

an inspiration to these kids
as these people that are on TV
and big blockbuster movies.

- Not only is that amazing
and those creative forces

deserve that attention,
but, you know,
that's also where all the youth is.

Maroon 5's production person/
marking person/press person,
that was a smart move.

- (FBE) So finally, this video's
honoring inspirational women,

so we wanted to give you a chance
to do the same thing.

If you could honor one
inspirational woman out there,

who would you choose?
- Oh my god, no.

I'm gonna cry.
I'm gonna say my mom.

She's just a hard worker.
She just showed me

that there's no easy way
out of anything.

She's always been like
(speaks Spanish),

which means
"Turn on those batteries"

and get to work,
'cause that's the only way
you're gonna hustle in this life.

- My mom's so awesome.
For her to just be this compassionate

and loving figure
and such a role model in my life,
she deserves the world.

- Emma Watson, because she's been
an activist in women's rights

and just so many different things
ever since Harry Potter.

- My wife. I'm in awe
all the time of every task

that she takes on.
It's unbelievable.

- Maybe Elizabeth Warren?
(chuckles) Maybe Ruth Bader Ginsburg.

I'm just letting you know
that there are a lot

of iconic women that would fit
right into that video.

- My mom is the nicest person
I've ever met in my life.

She taught me
"Kill 'em with kindness"

in the sense that instead
of getting revenge,

instead of getting mad,
just find a way to love each other,
and it'll work out.

- I've always been obsessed
with Audrey Hepburn,

not just because she was
this EGOT winner,

but I just felt like she spent
a lot of her later years giving back.

- Jennifer Lopez. She's done so much
for our community to make us present

in American culture
and to make it clear

that we're here, that this is us,
that we're part of our country.

- My mom is a straight G.
She went through so much.

We've been homeless.
We've been broke.

We've lived on our own.
My mom is such an inspiration,

and she can just
go through anything.

(choked up) This is the first time
I've ever cried on this show,

but it's because my mom
has done so much.

This song should be
dedicated to her.

I don't care what anybody says.
Forget Camila Cabello,

forget Cardi B.
This song is for my mom.

- Thanks so much for watching
this episode of Adults React.

- Subscribe and hit the bell
for more great content.

Shoutout to Y3llow Sunshin3
and Jasmine McKinnon.

- Thanks for watching, you guys.
See you later.

- Hi, guys. JC here,
producer here at FBE.

Thanks so much for watching
this episode of Adults React.

Make sure to check us out
on Instagram, @fbe,

for a behind-the-scenes look
at how we put

all these episodes together.
Links are down below. Bye, guys.
